Programme d'eau Potable et
            Assainissement en Milieu Rural : Cadre environmental Raport
            de Synthese

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Water and Sanitation Project
            of Haiti aims to improve the quality of life and health
            conditions of rural communities through the provision of
            drinking water and sanitation services. The specific
            objectives of the Program are to: a) Increase sustainable
            and efficient access to drinking water for participating
            communities; b) Improve sanitation facilities and hygiene
            practices for participating communities; c) Strengthen the
            capacity of Service National de lEau Potable (SNEP).
            Short-term negative impacts of the Project include: dust,
            noise and interruption of traffic during the construction
            phase; pollution and risks of accidents during the execution
            of the work; and livelihood disruption once the work was
            done. No indirect and/or long term negative impacts are
            expected owing to activities under this project in the
            project area. Small-scale changes in land use may occur
            through the digging and recovering of trenches for pipes on
            private land, and through the construction of small tanks.
            Impacts of these changes in land use will be compensated
            within the community during the preparatory and design phase
            of the project. The project has been designed to minimize
            adverse impacts.
